numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed many things in this graph.
2. The younger generation is more optimistic about the world than the older generation.
3. In the older generation, only 6 countries are above 50%.
4. In the younger generation, 12 countries are above 50%.
5. I wonder why Indonesia has a high percentage in the younger generation.
6. I wonder why Indonesia has a high percentage in the older generation.
7. In Indonesia, many people say that the world is getting better with each generation.
8. This graph relates to me and my community.
9. Many people from 15 to 24 in the world think that the world is getting better with each generation.
10. Many people from 15 to 24 choose jobs.
11. Many people from 15 to 24 start to impact the world.
12. These people have a positive mindset.
13. These people think that their generation can improve the world.
14. This affects my community.
15. This affects me.
16. I am part of that generation.
17. I try to help the world.
18. The graph is a scatter plot.
19. The graph has a line of best fit.
20. The graph shows an effect of age on a view.
21. The graph shows an effect of country on a view.
22. The view is about whether the world is getting better with each generation.
23. The headline is: Is the younger generation too optimistic or is the older generation just realistic?
